response.original_title: ALTAÏR Conférence - Australie, du grand Ouest à la Tasmanie
response.overview: After 18 years of regular trips to Australia, Jean Charbonneau and Dong Wei take you on a discovery of a lesser-known, wilder, and more grandiose Australia.  In Western Australia, the largest Australian state (5 times the size of France) you will live the dream of large red, semi-desert spaces, a paradisiacal coastline and unique natural curiosities where the largest iron and steel mines are hidden. gold of the world. Perth is the capital, young, rich, isolated.  Tasmania is the smallest Australian state, and offers you just the opposite: green, hilly, refreshing landscapes where the tallest trees in the world grow, hiding an extraordinary fauna, such as wombats, pademelons and especially the famous devils . Like Switzerland in Australia, traditions and the art of good living are cultivated there.
response.title: Altaïr Conferences – AUSTRALIA, From the Great West to Tasmania
